content.question: Which of the following is a drawback to using biofuels, such as ethanol, as a fuel source?

choices.label: Ethanol-blended gasoline has higher carbon emissions than petroleum alone.
The global demand for biofuels is continually decreasing.
There is high energy investment in producing and processing the crops needed for ethanol production.
Ethanol-blended gasoline increases the likelihood of freezing gas lines in winter months.

content.answer: There is high energy investment in producing and processing the crops needed for ethanol production.

skill.text: Skill 7.B: Describe potential responses or approaches to environmental problems.
